item.title: From Casa de paz Please watch this short video inviting you to...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

From Casa de paz Please watch this short video inviting you to our memorial service to honor the lives of immigrants who have perished along the US/Mexico border in 2020.

Find more info about our memorial service and the Zoom link here: https://www.casadepazcolorado.org/‚Ä¶/the-longest-night-of-th‚Ä¶

A big thank you to Rocky Mountain PBS for sharing this story and encouraging folks to attend the service.

Casa de Paz offers shelter and support to immigrants in Colorado. This winter solstice, they are remembering the lives of people who passed away trying to make it to America.

rmpbs.org

Colorado nonprofit honors the memory of immigrants who died trying to cross the border in 2020

Casa de Paz offers shelter and support to immigrants in Colorado. This winter solstice, they are remembering the lives of people who passed away trying to make it to America.Casa de Paz offers shelter and support to immigrants in Colorado. This winter solstice, they are remembering the lives of people who passed away trying to make it to America.
item.author: Abolish ICE Denver

item.title: "One of the policies the families were subjected to was the...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

"One of the policies the families were subjected to was the asylum transit ban, which required immigrants to first seek protection in another country through which they traveled before asking for refuge in the US. In July, the 9th Circuit Court of Appeals also blocked the rule, but the ruling didn't help any of the thousands of immigrants, like these families, who had already been subjected to the transit ban.

Under the transit ban policy, those who crossed through a third co...untry, such as Mexico or Guatemala, before arriving at the US southern border were denied asylum during their credible fear interviews, an initial step in the asylum process. After being denied the chance to be screened for asylum, these children and their families were subjected to expedited removal, which allows the government to deport undocumented immigrants without a hearing in front of an immigration judge.Federal courts have said they don't have the authority to weigh in on expedited removals. As a result, judges can't stop the deportation of these families, even though they've found that the policies leading to their deportations are illegal."

See More"These are refugees who are being sent back to the same situation they fled from," an immigration attorney told BuzzFeed News.

buzzfeednews.com

Immigrant Families Are Being Deported Without Their Asylum Claims Heard Lawfully, Advocates Say

"These are refugees who are being sent back to the same situation they fled from," an immigration attorney told BuzzFeed News."These are refugees who are being sent back to the same situation they fled from," an immigration attorney told BuzzFeed News.

item.title: "A recent report that stated immigration is not a top...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

"A recent report that stated immigration is not a top priority for the incoming Biden administration caused whiplash among some activists who were reminded of the oft-criticized approach of the Obama administration, while others said they will wait and see how the administration conducts itself in its early days with respect to the high-stakes issue.

Citing a person close to the transition, the NPR report said the view among many in Biden-world is that immigration activists have become too "adversarial," with policy demands that make Biden's team "uncomfortable."

A recent report that stated immigration is not a top priority for the incoming Biden administration caused whiplash among some activists, who were reminded of the oft-criticized approach of the Obama administration.

newsweek.com

In Biden commitment to immigration, activists see echoes of concerns with Obama

A recent report that stated immigration is not a top priority for the incoming Biden administration caused whiplash among some activists, who were reminded of the oft-criticized approach of the Obama administration.A recent report that stated immigration is not a top priority for the incoming Biden administration caused whiplash among some activists, who were reminded of the oft-criticized approach of the Obama administration.

item.title: "We were able to win in court against humanitarian aid...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

"We were able to win in court against humanitarian aid being criminalized, but migration is still being criminalized. That‚Äôs the core of it, and that‚Äôs the root problem. Biden will likely stop wall construction, but I think under both Democrats and Republicans, we‚Äôve seen a gradual increase in border militarization."

https://www.thenation.com/a‚Ä¶/society/no-more-deaths-arizona/

Agents have targeted Arizona‚Äôs No More Deaths after the group went public with evidence of abuses of power in immigration enforcement.

item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

Register here: https://secure.afsc.org/onlineactio‚Ä¶/6iY9ohwoFEu8WAnRiTG50w2

FEATURING:
***Music of***

...

Sophia Clark from Let Them Roar
The Pink Hawks
Kerrie Joy & Such
WAYNE WATTS

~~~Spoken Word from~~~

Tania Chairez
Alejandro Fuentes
Alejandro Jimenez, Emmy-nominated poet
Bobby LeFebre, Colorado Poet Laureate

###Speakers###

Not1More Deportation
Elisabeth Epps, Colorado Freedom Fund
Raul Medina, Colorado People's Alliance

Join us in expressing and imagining a world without cages. The urgency to Free Them All has never been greater. Together we've been sounding the alarm and demanding action month on month, day by day - hustling for that world where everyone can come back to the table.

WE HEARD FROM YOU, our community, a yearning to be invited into believing and imagining the next level of being human - a world we can touch and live into, one without jails, prisons and detention. To bring our souls, hearts, minds and bodies in this future world we've invited healers, speakers, poets and musicians.

Join us to Free Them All, join us in collectively getting free. There'll be creative calls to action throughout the night so be ready to participate!
Click here to add our event to your calendar!

Virtual Concert and Teach-In: A World With Everyone at the Table

item.title: "In September, the House Oversight Committee found that ICE...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

"In September, the House Oversight Committee found that ICE detainees died after receiving inadequate medical care and that jail workers ‚Äúfalsified records to cover up‚Äù issues. That same month, a separate committee report issued by the House Homeland Security Committee found that ICE detainees are often given deficient medical care and that detention centers use segregation as a threat against immigrants [...]

The draft report obtained by BuzzFeed News documents how officials... at the detention facility in Calexico were using solitary confinement as a long term ‚Äúsolution‚Äù for immigrants in ‚Äúprotective custody,‚Äù or those who need special supervision or housing due to risks to their safety.

In addition to finding 11 immigrants had been kept in solitary confinement for more than 60 days and two others for more than 300 days, inspectors said there had been no documented review to evaluate the continued solitary confinement and the immigrants were not afforded recreation time for an hour a day, as required. The inspectors also said the detainees received inadequate medical checks."

See MoreInspectors also found that nearly a dozen immigrants detainees were kept in solitary confinement for more than two months.

buzzfeednews.com

DHS Inspectors Found ICE Detainees Who Were Kept In Solitary Confinement For 300 Days

Inspectors also found that nearly a dozen immigrants detainees were kept in solitary confinement for more than two months.Inspectors also found that nearly a dozen immigrants detainees were kept in solitary confinement for more than two months.

item.title: Solidarity with hunger striking detainees in Bergen County, New...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

Solidarity with hunger striking detainees in Bergen County, New Jersey! #FreeThemAll

Gabe DaBabe

Abolish ICE protest where I was arrested for practicing my first amendment right to press- first person footage of my arrest can be seen in this video. Bergen C...ounty Correctional Facility has a new contract with ICE to detain undocumented people in inhumane conditions. In response to this some of the detainees have thrown a hunger strike to demand their immediate release- this hunger strike has lasted over 30 days and nothing has changed regarding the conditions or their release. There is no such thing as ‚Äúillegal aliens‚Äù don‚Äôt let the language fool you into demonizing the true natives of this land. Don‚Äôt let political terms such as ‚Äúannexed‚Äù or ‚Äútreaty‚Äù fool you into believing that stripping people from their families is legal. The hypocrisy of America to deport people who come to this country for a better life is deadly and shameful.

See More

item.title: Content warning: body cam footage from the night Elijah was...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

Content warning: body cam footage from the night Elijah was murdered

The case of Elijah McClain‚Äôs murder by Aurora Police and paramedics was on 60 Minutes last night and the cop excuse of "Excited Delirium‚Äù: was exposed as the latest pseudoscientific justification for racist state terror.

"Excited delirium" was mentioned in the deaths of George Floyd and Elijah McClain, but some in the medical world are skeptical it's actually a condition. John Dickerson reports.

cbsnews.com

How a questionable syndrome, "Excited Delirium," could be protecting police officers from misconduct charges

"Excited delirium" was mentioned in the deaths of George Floyd and Elijah McClain, but some in the medical world are skeptical it's actually a condition. John Dickerson reports."Excited delirium" was mentioned in the deaths of George Floyd and Elijah McClain, but some in the medical world are skeptical it's actually a condition. John Dickerson reports.

item.title: ‚ÄúWith negotiations at an impasse, the contract went to a...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

‚ÄúWith negotiations at an impasse, the contract went to a third-party arbitrator to decide who gets what. Each side ‚Äî the city government and the police Denver Police Protective Association ‚Äî was to give its final offers to the decider, who would choose one or the other.

The union‚Äôs final offer, the lowest raise it would accept, was identical to the original contract ‚Äî 2.8 percent. But Mayor Hancock and the council could not agree on a figure, so they submitted nothing. The arbitrator gave police the raise they asked for.‚Äù

The new contract passed 10 to 3.

denverite.com

How Denver police officers secured a nearly 3% raise even though city council didn‚Äôt want to give them one

The new contract passed 10 to 3.The new contract passed 10 to 3.
item.author: Abolish ICE Denver

item.title: Via Comrade Shontel Lewis - RTD Director for District B I...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

Via Comrade Shontel Lewis - RTD Director for District B

I don‚Äôt know if you all have been paying attention to the egregious actions of Governor Jared S Polis . He has rejected the science and has relied on his bias, inserting his beliefs and feelings into when and whom have access to the vaccine. He used his authority to change the recommendation.

We all know someone that is in jail, prison and/or sometime experiencing homelessness. To deny them early access to the vaccine ...is criminal but since we are talking about people that society has deem as invaluable this is acceptable. Don‚Äôt let this slide.

I know you all are busy. But can you please do me a favor and contact your State Representative and Senators.

I know it can be scary to speak truth to power ‚Äî but you can and you must. We cannot accept that someone sentenced to a two year prison sentence is not only now on 24 hour lock down, but sentenced to death because they are denied early access to the vaccine.

Those are our brothers, sisters, cousins that are being forgotten about.

Your reps need to hear from you. Email and call, tell them to follow the science and not allow the personal feeling they have toward to those in prisons and jails cloud their judgment.

See MoreThis website requires javascript to run optimally on computers, mobile devices, and screen readers. Please enable javascript for the best experience!

leg.colorado.gov

item.title: Join us Friday, December 18 at 7 p.m. for a premiere virtual screening of ‚ÄúThe Facility.‚Äù ...
item.content:encoded:
Join us Friday, December 18 at 7 p.m. for a premiere virtual screening of “The Facility.”

“The Facility” is a short documentary film chronicling the lived experiences of immigrants being held at the GEO detention facility in Aurora, Colorado. This film addresses the personal loss and consequences caused by for-profit detention and the federal government's broken immigration policies. Legal and medical experts highlight horrific abuses including death, medical neglect, nutrition issues, and prolonged detention during the coronavirus pandemic. To tell their stories, current and former detainees, families fighting to be reunited, and advocates come together to share their experiences behind the walls of the GEO immigration detention facility in Aurora.

@acluofcolorado @coloradopeoplesalliance @co_immigrant @keshagrijalva @_floodlight_

Following the screening will be a Q&A session with the director, legal experts, and individuals featured in the film with first-hand experience of the systemic abuse occurring inside the facility.

Panelists include:

Jeremy Flood, “The Facility” Director
Raul Medina Perez, COPA, Community Organizer who was formerly detained at GEO
Kesha Davalos Grijalva, Immigrant rights advocate whose husband is detained at GEO
Keinada Andereas, Colorado Student who was formerly detained at GEO
Hans Meyer, The Meyer Law Office, Lead Attorney
Denise Maes, ACLU of Colorado, Public Policy Director

Please RSVP for the screening in advance for this free event: https://aclu.zoom.us/webinar/register/WN_nUbTy8-VQpif8nMzqtUzQw

Trailer: https://youtu.be/cGOCejy48Jo

“The Facility” is presented by ACLU of Colorado, Colorado Immigrant Rights Coalition, and Colorado Hispanic Bar Association.
